column4: im trying to install a plugin for pidgin, but i have to compile it. im in the directory i unpacked the archive into and i typed "make" and pressed enter but it just gave me a bunch of error messages. what am I doing wrong?
im following the directions as laid out EXACTLY in the readme
then the author probably made a mistake, did you run ./configure ?
*if* there is a configure file it sets up the compilation environment and creates the make file
Note: in the readme it says: "This is a source distribution and requires a working compiler toolchain."
type sudo aptitude update (to update the database), then sudo aptitude install build-essential

whoops I already had it installed, but for new trouble, for some mystical reason the package appears in synaptic when i type the first 5 letters, then disappears when i type the hyphen. I love ubuntu.
I think its time to !paste the output of your make attempt
I'm not certain but it could be that the author assumed you have pidgin complied from source too - I really suggest to ask the author
